column4: does anyone know why tftpd-hpa wouldn't be running after installing via apt?
no output, no action from that.  i think it's supposed to start from openbsd-inetd
there was no entry in /etc/inetd.conf for it, so i added one, although just by copying the line above and changing the bin and options.  but restarting inetd doesn't seem to have any effect
it should be in init.d like i said
right, so start it, and make sure you dont have any other tftpd servers installed
look at the script and maybe figure out why
i would do that rather than your hack to create a custom thin client
- no this is my first attempt.  all the ubuntu documentation pointed to ltsp-server
yeah i know -- people should be trying DRBL
in VLC media player, should File > Open Disc > then changing the device to /dev/cdrom play a dvd?
